channel.title: Music on Ziggurat
channel.description: Recent content in Music on Ziggurat

item.title: Project Hubbard Kickstarter
item.description: It’s hard to overstate the impact Rob Hubbard had on the UK games scene during the 80s. He was a prolific musician who turned out some incredible tunes. Seeing “Commando” at my mate’s place one afternoon after school helped convince me I needed a C64. I remember going back to his house, tape recorder in hand, to record the music to listen to on repeat (especially that lovely game over tune). It sounds kind of crazy now, but I bought games purely because they featured his music - and keep in mind, games weren’t cheap here in NZ. I was most certainly not alone in doing this.
